text: <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Promotes B Cell Survival and Proliferation In Vitro
Primary B cell cultures can be maintained through <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation and supplementation with <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 32 ] .

To investigate whether <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> affects primary B cell survival and proliferation , splenocytes were cultured in the presence or absence of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and analyzed by MTS as a metabolic marker , by ethidium monoazide ( EMA ) exclusion for viability , and by 5-bromo-2'-deoxy-uridine ( BrdU ) incorporation for proliferation .

In the MTS assay , as expected , splenocytes from wild-type mice did not survive even with the addition of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> due to a lack of <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation ( Figure 3A ) .

text: In contrast , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> splenocytes had increased metabolism even in the absence of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which was further enhanced upon addition of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Wild-type and <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphoma cells had high levels of MTS activity even in the absence of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Figure 3A ) .

The <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphoma cells had approximately 4-fold higher MTS activity than the normal transgenic lymphocytes and were at least 2-fold higher than the control lymphoma .
As previously published , lymphoma usually develops in mice over 12 mo of age and all mice are sacrificed by 18-20 mo .
The ages of the transgenic mice with or without lymphoma ranged between 6 and 20 mo old .
There was no correlation between age and MTS activity .

EMA exclusion of <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + gated B cells prepared from two wild-type and two <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic mice indicated a 2-fold increase in viability in the <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphocytes compared to wild-type lymphocytes .

Two examples of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphoma cells had greatly increased viability that was not increased by <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment , indicating that the lymphoma cells are independent of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> co - stimulation ( Figure 3B ) .

Enhancement in MTS activity was observed in <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphoma cells by the addition of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; however , EMA exclusion did not reveal a similar increase .

This could reflect a difference for <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> requirement in the metabolic activity versus the viability of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphoma cells .

Although expression of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could enhance survival of non-malignant primary lymphocytes , BrdU incorporation revealed that <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression alone was not sufficient to induce proliferation in culture ( unpublished data ) .

text: Only lymphoma cells had detectable levels of BrdU incorporation detected by flow cytometry ( Figure 3C ) .

Interestingly , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> lymphoma cells had significantly higher levels of proliferation in comparison to the spontaneous lymphoma that developed in an <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - negative littermate ( 25 % versus 4 % ) .

This higher level of proliferation was observed in lymphomas that express both high ( Table 1 , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - L2 and <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - L3 ) and low ( Table 1 , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - L5 ) levels of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , suggesting that even small amounts of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is sufficient to induce dramatic effects in proliferation .

text: The level of proliferation was not enhanced upon <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> addition , confirming the <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> independence observed in the viability studies ( Figure 3C ; Table1 ) .
